articles.title: UN urged to take measures against U.S. policy of aggression
Month of international solidarity with Korean people closes
U.S. clamour about "missile threat" from DPRK refuted
articles.content:
Month of international solidarity with Korean people closes
    Havana, August 9 (KCNA) -- A closing ceremony of the month of international solidarity with the Korean people was held in Cuba on July 31.
 At the ceremony the executive secretary of the Cuban committee for supporting Korea's reunification said that the united states is aggravating the situation of the Korean peninsula, instead of drawing a lesson from its defeat in the Korean War.
 The U.S. should stop at once such acts as laying obstacles to detente and peace on the Korean peninsula, he urged.    
 Then, an art performance was given by Cuban artistes before a Korean film "Panmunjom." was screened.

articles.title: 15th World Festival of Youth and Students opens
Delegations and delegates of overseas compatriots arrive
News of Kim Jong Il's official visit to Russia widely reported abroad
articles.content:
Delegations and delegates of overseas compatriots arrive
    Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Secretary general of the International United Confederation of Koreans (International Kothongryon) and its delegate Jo Yun Hae  and vice-chairman of the United Confederation of Koreans in the Uzbek Republic and its delegate Ko Tae Chun arrived here yesterday by plane to participate in the 2001 Grand Festival for National Reunification.
 Arriving here earlier by plane were chairman of the council of the International Kothongryon and the United Confederation of Koreans in the Kazakh Republic Kang Sun Ho, a delegation of the United Confederation of Korean Youth in Russia led by its chairman Ri Phyong Bom, secretary general of the United Confederation of Koreans in Russia and its delegate An Hyang San, a delegation of the United Confederation of Koreans in the far east led by Ri Hak Song and chairman of the United Confederation of Koreans in Ukraine and its delegate Kim Yong Sul.

articles.title: Anecdotes about Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
News of Kim Jong Il's official visit to Russia widely reported abroad
    Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- As many as five billion people around the world including political and public figures listen to news of leader Kim Jong Il's historic official visit to Russia everyday, according to information available.
 Every news of his visit to Russia was specially reported everyday by TVs in more than 150 countries. Among them were hundreds of Russian national and regional TVs such as NTV, ort and central TV, Chinese Central TV, CNN TV, BBC Radio and TV, TVs no.1 and no.3 of France and NHK TV.    
 A total of 30 billion people around the world listened to news of his official visit to Russia since the first report on Kim Jong Il's meeting with President Putin was released on August 4.
